column4: Could someone please tell me the name of the ati open source driver?  I need to confirm it is installed
the actual driver is in xserver-xorg-video-radeon, but -video-ati depends on it
ah, not found so it is not installed after all.  That would explain my 3D not working.
and yet synaptic says it is installed.....this really is a mess!
pastebin your /var/log/Xorg.0.log
http://pastebin.ca/1885267
so what happens if you 'sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-radeon' ?
but synaptic says it is already installed
what about xserver-xorg-video-ati ? X seems to be trying to use that wrapper
It installed it.  I assume I have to restart?
ok, restarted.....
pastebin your /var/log/Xorg.0.log again
http://pastebin.ca/1885284
looks good to me
yeah, still not working though....
what isn't, exactly?
when I restarted, my windows still have to title bar or close/minimize/window buttons.  I cannot move them.  I have to go to System>Preferences>Appearance>Visual Effects>Extra to turn them on.
and no compiz
nope, just restarted and I have to go through the whole System>Preferences>Appearance>Visual Effects>Extra thing to be able to use my system
does compiz work when you do that?
nope
